Posts.Content: RealtorJackie wrote:    I had a centralized lumpectomy about 2 weeks ago.  At my post-op appointment, the surgeon noticed I had a hematoma.  He said it would go down in a couple of weeks,  Guess what?  It burst last night, and blew through the corner of my incision.  I woke up a bloody mess.  Has anyone else had this experience?  Also I was sleeping part way on my tummy with a pillow wedged on my side.    The bleeding has decreased to just an oozing, and the doctor said I should come in tomorrow. Dx 8/23/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIC, Grade 2, 15/23 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Hematoma RealtorJackie BarbaraA

Posts.Content: RealtorJackie wrote:        Tomorrow I have the mediastinoscopy and broncoscopy.  They will cut my throat and take out all the speckaly lymph nodes that lit up on my last PET.  It could be my bc spreading, or a new primary cancer, or nothing.  Praying it's nothing!  I just had 1/2 my roof blown off 2 weeks ago, when a tornado came through.  I already have mets  in my bones.  It's just been sucky lately.  Keep me in your prayers. Dx 8/23/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIC, Grade 2, 15/23 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: RealtorJackie wrote:   My PET scan showed that the cancer in my bones has lessened.  I am so happy. Thank you for all your good wishes and support and prayers! Dx 8/23/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIC, Grade 2, 15/23 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Finally, some good news! RealtorJackie justjudie

Posts.Content: RealtorJackie wrote:       Here I am ladies.  This is my first hello.  After yearly mammos, yearly exams by dr., monthly self exams,  I found a slight thickening in my breast.  It was early June.  Right around my 50th birthday.  Went to the doctor in August--still no lump--just a small thickening.  I am stage IIIC.  I have had my last surgery 4 weeks ago.  Developed a hematoma(large), and it is still draining.  Waiting for chemo to start.  I am feeling like I want to crawl out of my skin.  This waiting to heal, and chemo to start is a really difficult time.    Dx 8/23/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIC, Grade 2, 15/23 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I'm In the Club RealtorJackie Maureen813
